Event.name: Having_commercial_agreement
Event.definition: <def-root><fen>Party_1</fen> and <fen>Party_2</fen> (collectively refered to as <fen>Parties</fen>) make a commercial agreement, an <fen>Obligation</fen>, which both <fen>Parties</fen> are expected to keep or fulfill. </def-root>

Arg.name: Party_1
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the commercial agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus manner expressions are construed to apply to <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily to <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Party_2
Arg.definition: <def-root>The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with). </def-root>

Arg.name: Obligation
Arg.definition: <def-root>An expression of the commitment which the <fen>Parties</fen> have to engage in a commercial transaction. </def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the commercial agreement. </def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition:
<def-root>As with other frames in the Communication domain, the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication may be expressed. <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to record or negotiate the <fen>Obligation</fen>.
<ex>The parties have a <fex name="med">written</fex> <t>agreement</t> to arbitrate disputes arising in connection with the contract.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Parties
Arg.definition: <def-root>The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having a commercial agreement. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
</def-root>
